div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":7345,"message":"The health and safety of our students, staff, and community are paramount to Val Verde and all of our educational partners. After careful deliberation, and at the guidance of Riverside County Public Health, schools are closed for the remainder of the school year. Please visit our dedicated COVID-19 information page at www.valverde.edu\/covid19 for any and all updates.","type":"overlay"}]}

div.p: The information we provide toyou about COVID-19 will change rapidly. The following FAQ should help provide some clarity however be aware that we will updateyouwith any new information as it evolves.

p.strong: What is the most important thing to do?

div.p: Washyourhands with soap and waterfor20 seconds. Ifyouhave symptomsofCOVID-19 and can stay home we recommend thatyoudo. It is still cold and flu season, COVID-19 is not the only reasonforus all to stay vigilant about being healthy!

p.strong: Should we stay at home if we have a fever?

div.p: Thisis a great idea. We recommend that all children and staff members with a feverof(>100.4 F / >38C) or higher should remain home from school and other activities until they have been fever-freeforat least 24 hours without the assistanceofmedication.

p.strong: Hand Sanitizer vs Hand Washing, what wins?

div.p: The most effective way to keep germs at bay is to washyourhandsforat least 20 seconds with soap. We have increased hand sanitizer dispensers significantly at every school and the District Office butthisdoes not replace hand washing.
The CentersforDisease Control and Prevention (CDC) does not recommend routine useofa facemask or respirator. It is important that we do not deplete stock from those who need themforother illnesses.

p.strong: What if someone at VVUSD is exposed to the riskofCOVID-19?

div.p: It is important to note that we unknowingly are exposed to threats to our health every day. We will remain vigilant about investigating all reported cases. Should a confirmed caseofCOVID-19 exist in VVUSD we will be directed by the expert government agencies on how to take the necessary next steps.Thissituation will be handled on a case by case basis.

p.strong: If I decide not to send my student to school or come to VVUSD will absences be excused?

div.p: We understand community concern about student health and safety. Some families have asked about keeping their own child home based on the fearofcontracting COVID-19 at school.Thisis certainly an option any family may consider. However, per Education Code atthistime, we are unable to mark an absence excusedforthisreason. Our normal protocol remains in place.

Yes. At this time VVUSD, under the guidance of the Office of the Governor, has decided to cancel all athletics, field trips, travel, and after school activities (excluding the Think Together Program) at least through the end of March.

b.i: Schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year.

div.p: Please use only official government agency outlets to obtain information,forexample:

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout thats similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
